newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: FAO to study AIDS impact on Zimbabwe food output.
newsitem.headline: FAO to study AIDS impact on Zimbabwe food output.

text.p: The United Nations Food and Agricultural Organisation (FAO) plans to study the impact of the killer disease AIDS on farming production in rural Zimbabwe, an FAO official said on Monday.

Erich Baier, a senior officer for agricultural education and extension, told reporters his organisation had already studied the potential impact of AIDS on food production systems in Rwanda, Tanzania and Malawi.
Studies in these countries showed that rural communities had been most hit by AIDS, which was claiming a majority of its victims from the productive 15- to 40 age group, he said.

Baier said the study on Zimbabwe -- where AIDS is killing an estimated 300 people every week and where a 10th of the 10.5 million population are believed to have the HIV virus that causes the disease -- would start soon, but he gave no date.
The FAO official said there was now need to use more machinery to break rural Africa's reliance on labour-intensive food production methods.
